title: The
base
b
c
keyword is used to access members from a base class. It is commonly used to call base implementations of virtual methods, or to specify which base constructor should be called.

inline_content.Text: keyword is used to access members from a base class. It is commonly used to call base implementations of virtual methods, or to specify which base constructor should be called.

title: Calling base implementation of virtual method
b

inline_content.Text: Calling base implementation of virtual method

title: It is possible to use the base keyword to call a base implementation from any method. This ties the method call directly to the base implementation, which means that even if new child classes override a virtual method, the base implementation will still be called so this needs to be used with caution.

inline_content.Text: It is possible to use the base keyword to call a base implementation from any method.
